jobicade.util.geom

Enum Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Direction>
      • jobicade.util.geom.Direction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Direction>

    public enum Direction
extends java.lang.Enum<Direction>
    Enum representing the eight cardinal directions and the "null" direction, center.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      CENTER
      The null center direction.
      EAST
      The east direction, equivalent to right.
      NORTH
      The north direction, equivalent to top.
      NORTH_EAST
      The north east direction, equivalent to top right.
      NORTH_WEST
      The north west direction, equivalent to top left.
      SOUTH
      The south direction, equivalent to bottom.
      SOUTH_EAST
      The south east direction, equivalent to bottom right.
      SOUTH_WEST
      The south west direction, equivalent to bottom left.
      WEST
      The west direction, equivalent to left.

      • values

        public static Direction[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (Direction c : Direction.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static Direction valueOf(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • getUnit

        public Point getUnit()
        Returns a point representing a translation based on 1 unit in this direction. Diagonal directions return a unit both horizontally and vertically, so the translation is actually sqrt(2).
        Returns:
        A point representing a unit translation in this direction.

      • get

        public static Direction get(int row,
                            int col)
        Returns the direction in the given row and column. The left hand side is column 0, the right hand side is column 2, the top side is row 0 and the bottom side is row 2.
        Parameters:
        row - The row.
        col - The column.
        Returns:
        The direction in the given row and column.

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        Returns:
        The row of this direction.
        See Also:
        get(int, int)

      • getCol

        public int getCol()
        Returns:
        The row of this direction.
        See Also:
        get(int, int)

      • withRow

        public Direction withRow(int row)
        Returns the corresponding direction in the same column and the given row.
        Parameters:
        row - The row.
        Returns:
        The corresponding direction in the same column and the given row.

      • withCol

        public Direction withCol(int col)
        Returns the corresponding direction in the same row and the given column.
        Parameters:
        col - The column.
        Returns:
        The corresponding direction in the same row and the given column.

      • mirrorRow

        public Direction mirrorRow()
        Mirrors this direction's row. For example, NORTH becomes SOUTH.
        Returns:
        This direction with mirrored row.

      • mirrorCol

        public Direction mirrorCol()
        Mirrors this direction's column. For example, WEST becomes EAST.
        Returns:
        This direction with mirrored column.

      • mirror

        public Direction mirror()
        Mirrors this direction, both row and column.
        Returns:
        The mirrored direction.
